page.title: 01FORT AUGUSTUS AREA.
page.content: The village of {Fort-Augustus }is situated at the southern end of {Loch {Ness,}in the {Great Glen,}33 miles from {Inverness}and 32 miles from { {Fort William.} The {Great Glen}is a natural route through the Highlands.The lochs and rivers in the glen have long been used for transport and the present road system follows these features.{Fort {Augustus}being in the middle of the glen,is a natural route and service centre.It is a stopping off point for many people who travel through the glen by road or water. The village (pop.800),is split by the{River Oich }and {Caledonian Canal which run parallel to each other through the centre.The village is named after{William Augustus,}the{Duke {of Cumberland,}who routed the{ {Jacobites}at the {Battle of Culloden.
